title: Scrutiny of Indian Tycoons Deals a Blow to Modi’s Privatization Drive
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi assumed office nearly a decade ago with a goal of privatizing more of India’s floundering state-owned assets. For the nation’s business elite, that message was a clarion call to rescue an inefficient public sector.

title: Biden, McCarthy Have Productive Talk on Debt But No Deal Yet
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said he and President Joe Biden had a productive talk but have not yet reached a deal to avert a catastrophic US debt default.

title: E. Jean Carroll Wants to Add Trump’s CNN Town Hall Comments to Defamation Suit
description: The New York author who won a civil sexual-abuse suit against Donald Trump earlier this month is seeking court permission to amend an earlier defamation lawsuit against the former president to add comments he made about her on a recent CNN town hall.

title: Mexico’s Top Court Invalidates AMLO’s Flagship Works Decree
description: Mexico’s Supreme Court invalidated a decree by President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador designating some of his flagship public works of national security and public interest.

title: Debt Talks Now Set Table for Future Spending Fights
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. This week we're focusing on the debt-ceiling drama. Today, Steven T. Dennis looks at what’s at stake and what’s ahead. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Doctors in England to Hold 72-Hour Strike After Talks Break Down
description: Junior doctors in England will stage another 72-hour walkout over pay, as they warn of a summer of industrial action after talks with the government broke down.

title: Yellen Says It’s Now ‘Highly Likely’ US Out of Cash Early June
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said it’s now “highly likely” that her department will run out of sufficient cash in early June, and repeated her warning that the moment could come as soon as June 1.

title: The Debt-Limit Fight Is Going Down to the Wire. Here’s What to Watch
description: The debt-limit fight President Joe Biden and Speaker Kevin McCarthy are trying to negotiate boils down to a few key issues.

title: Chinese Citizens Sue Florida Over Ban That They Won’t Let Them Buy Homes in State
description: A group of Chinese citizens who live and work in Florida filed a federal lawsuit challenging a statute championed by Governor Ron DeSantis that bars people whose permanent residence is in China from buying homes in the state.

title: Mitsotakis Is Breaking Out of the Box Greek Leftists Put Him In
description: Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis didn’t just defy the pollsters with his landslide election victory in Greece on Sunday. He also bust open the constraints that his main political opponent had tried to place on him.

title: Russia Is Moving Weapons to Ukraine Through Mali, US Says
description: The US suspects Russian mercenary firm Wagner Group is trying to ship weapons to fighters in Ukraine through the West African nation of Mali, according to State Department Spokesman Matthew Miller.

title: US Expresses ‘Serious Concerns’ About China Move Against Micron
description: The US has “serious concerns” about China’s move to restrict sales of Micron Technology Inc. products in the country, and is engaging with the nation’s government to make its views clear, the State Department said.

title: UK Speeding-Ticket Row Shows Sunak’s Hard Road to Election Day
description: Rishi Sunak pledged to restore integrity and professionalism to his Conservative government when he took office in October. But even as he glad-handed world leaders at the Group of Seven summit in Japan, his scandal-ridden party was coming up with yet another distraction.

title: Germany’s Scholz Backs Biden Over Trump in Tight US Race
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said he wants US President Joe Biden to be re-elected because the Democrat is better for America, adding that former President Donald Trump stands for a “great division” in his country which would also be bad for Germany.

title: Debt-Limit Talks Productive Ahead of Biden Meeting, McCarthy Says
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said debt-limit discussions Monday morning with White House negotiators were productive ahead of a planned meeting later in the day with President Joe Biden.

title: The Fear Premium in Bills Is Growing as Debt-Cap Fight Drags On
description: Yields on most at-risk securities leaped ahead of Biden-McCarthy meeting

title: New IDB Chief Pivots Latin America Bank Away From US-China Feud
description: The new head of Latin America’s top development bank is trying to steer clear of the global US-China competition, avoiding the course of his predecessor who aimed to use the lender to counter Beijing’s influence in the region.

title: Spanish Football’s Attempt to Deal With Racism Hits New Low
description: Spain’s football league has long attempted to promote its image by tightly controlling what can be broadcast. One star has had enough of this sanitized version of the competition though.

title: Biden Names FCC Picks, Pushes for Democratic Majority at Deadlocked Agency
description: President Joe Biden moved to lock in his first Democratic majority at the Federal Communications Commission, naming veteran government lawyer Anna Gomez to an open seat and proposing to extend the service of two current commissioners.

title: White House Threatens to Veto Republican Bill Thwarting Student-Debt Relief
description: President Joe Biden is threatening to veto a House resolution that aims to dismantle his student-debt relief plan, which is currently ensnared in legal challenges.

title: Sidney Powell’s Tossed Ethics Case Appealed by Texas Bar Panel
description: Attorney ethics enforcers in Texas are appealing the dismissal of their complaint against Donald Trump ally Sidney Powell over her failed legal efforts to undermine the results of the 2020 presidential election.

title: Ukraine’s Russian-Occupied Atomic Reactor in New Power Outage
description: A Russia-occupied nuclear-power plant outside the southeast Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia lost power Monday, and had to rely on emergency generators before operations were restored.

title: Tim Scott’s Trying to Beat Trump as a Nice Guy With Wall Street Backing
description: Senator Tim Scott is testing whether Wall Street’s support can help his long-shot bid to move Republicans away from the grievance-laced politics of Donald Trump.

title: White House Negotiators at Capitol for Debt-Limit Talks
description: The White House negotiating team arrived at the US Capitol early Monday as talks on raising the debt limit stretch into the final days before a default.

title: Kremlin Says Russia Repelling Border Incursion From Ukraine
description: Russian forces are battling attackers who crossed over the border from Ukraine, the Kremlin said, in the second such incursion reported by Moscow in two months.

title: A Kingdom for Footballers and Men of War
description: In the space of a few weeks, Saudi Arabia has hosted some big global names that underline how the kingdom is positioning itself in the world.

title: Russia's Oil Flows Stay High Even as Moscow Insists Cuts Made
description: Shipments from Russian ports are 1.2 million barrels a day higher than at the end of 2022

title: What India’s Removal of 2,000 Rupee Notes Means for the Economy?
description: India is withdrawing its highest value currency note from circulation, giving consumers and businesses a four-month deadline to exchange or deposit the legal tender, a move reminiscent of a shock demonetization exercise in 2016.

title: Starmer Says UK Labour Would Ban Daytime Junk Food, Vaping Ads
description: Opposition Labour Party leader Keir Starmer said he would ban junk food and vaping commercials on British television before 9 p.m. if he becomes prime minister, as part of a major overhaul of the nation’s health.

title: US Officials Probe a New Layer in Opaque Drug Pricing, Supply System
description: US authorities are trying to open a window on an emerging dimension of the drug-purchasing sector that’s further obscuring how much medicines cost.

title: Thai Coalition Pact Omits Law on Royals to Build Support
description: Thailand’s pro-democracy parties signed a pact that outlines their common objectives in forming a government after winning the May 14 election, making no mention of amending the lese majeste law, in a move seen as key to building support for Pita Limjaroenrat to become prime minister.

title: Turkey’s Presidential Election Loser Could Emerge as Key Player in Runoff
description: Turkish nationalist politician Sinan Ogan, who won 5.2% of votes in the first round of the recent presidential election, is set to announce whether he will throw his support behind President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Sunday’s runoff.

title: What the Word Salad Over China Really Means
description: In the ups and downs of the relationship between China and a host of other powers, the language is becoming increasingly tangled.

title: China Blasts US ‘Sincerity’ as Biden Calls for More Talks
description: China has questioned the “sincerity” of the Biden administration, as it pushes to resume high-level diplomatic talks with Beijing while also heaping tech sanctions on its main economic rival.

title: Thailand’s Move Forward Faces New Legal Threat to Coalition Bid
description: A Thai lawyer filed a complaint against the party that won last week’s general election over its vow to amend the country’s royal defamation law, the latest sign that the process of forming a new government could get protracted.

title: Micron Stock Tumbles as China Says Its Chips Are Security Risk
description: Micron Technology Inc.’s stock dropped more than 6% after China’s cyberspace regulator said that its products failed to pass a cybersecurity review in the country.

title: US-Papua New Guinea Defense Deal Seen as Bid to Counter China
description: The US and Papua New Guinea signed two new security agreements on Monday aimed at bolstering ties in a move seen as an effort to counter to China’s growing influence in the Pacific.

title: Eskom Latest: Fuel Costs for Netcare; Astral Foods Skips Payout
description: South Africa’s largest private health-care network expects diesel costs to more than quadruple to 165 million rand ($8.5 million) this year as it runs generators to help contain the impact of rolling blackouts.

title: Greek Stocks and Bonds Rally as Premier Secures Wide Support
description: Greece’s stocks and government bonds gained at the open as Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis secured surprisingly strong support in Sunday’s vote, fueling optimism on the outlook for market-friendly reforms.

title: Sri Lanka Eyes Chinese Tourism to Help Ease Debt Crisis
description: Sri Lanka is mulling measures to lure back Chinese tourists in a bid to alleviate an unprecedented debt crisis, its tourism minister said, as the South Asian nation tries to stabilize the economy.

title: Ukraine Recap: Russian Missiles Pierce Air Defenses
description: Ukraine reported damage to dozens of buildings and vehicles in the central city of Dnipro after another barrage of Russian missiles was unleashed overnight.

title: Romanian Teachers Go on Nationwide Strike to Demand Higher Pay
description: Romanian teachers held a nationwide strike for the first time in two decades, demanding higher wages and better working conditions.

title: South African Capital Hit by Cholera Outbreak With 12 Dead
description: Twelve people have died of cholera and 95 have visited hospitals with symptoms that indicate they could have the disease in Tshwane, the municipality that encompasses the South African capital of Pretoria.

title: Biden-McCarthy Meeting on Debt Limit Comes as Time Runs Short
description: President Joe Biden and Republican House Speaker Kevin McCarthy are set to meet Monday for talks on averting a catastrophic US default as time runs short and key differences remain.

title: Messi, Ronaldo Lead Saudi Arabia's Multibillion-Dollar Makeover
description: Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman wants to diversify the economy with a tourism boost, but many observers fear the effort will divert attention from Saudi Arabia's human rights record.

title: Singapore’s PM Lee Tests Positive for Covid
description: Singapore’s Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has tested positive for Covid-19, he said in a Facebook post.

title: US-Papua New Guinea Pact Won’t Militarize Indo-Pacific, New Zealand Leader Says
description: New Zealand Prime Minister Chris Hipkins isn’t concerned that a renewed partnership agreement between the US and Papua New Guinea represents militarization of the Indo-Pacific region.
